PolyPharma.Utils.GDF_export module¶

Module containing an objet that allows an easy export of the matrix-encoded information to GDF without the need to export the whole relation matrix

class PolyPharma.Utils.GDF_export.GDF_export_Interface(target_fname, field_names, field_types, node_properties_dict, mincurrent, Idx2Label, Label2Idx, current_Matrix, directed=False)[source]¶

Bases: object

An interface allowing the export of the matrix relatioin object and node characteristics to a GDF format, compatible with visualization with appropriate tools.

Parameters:
  • target_fname – name of the file to which the GDF file will be written to
  • field_names – Names of different fields for the node description
  • field_types – Types of different nodes for the node description
  • node_properties_dict – dictionary mapping the node labels to outputs
  • mincurrent – minimal current below which we are not rendering the links anymore
  • Idx2Label – Mapping from the indexes curent matrix lines/columns to the node labels
  • current_Matrix – matrix of currents from which we wish to rendred the GDF
Authorised_names = ['VARCHAR', 'DOUBLE', 'BOOLEAN', 'DOUBLE']¶
verify()[source]¶
Raises:
  • Exception – “GDF Node declaration is wrong!” - of the length of field names and field type differ
  • Exception – “Wrong Types were declared, ....” - if the declared types are not in the Authorised names
write()[source]¶
write_edgedefs()[source]¶

Write defintions for the edges. Right now, the information passing through the edges is restricted to the current

write_edges()[source]¶

Writes informations about edges connections. These informations are pulled from the conductance matrix.

write_nodedefs()[source]¶

Takes in the dictionary that maps and returns the nodedefs line

write_nodes()[source]¶

Write the nodes with associated informations
